bwwExcerpt: It's not a good sign when a show's most memorable and colorful performance comes from the four-legged cast member. But that's the way it goes for the Atlantic Theater Company's anemic and sometimes tinny-sounding reboot of "The Threepenny Opera."...Despite a cast of seasoned pros, Clarke's vision of the dark and moody Kurt Weill-Bertolt Brecht opera, fails to come together in a compelling or cohesive way.
